attributes.action: Make First Aid & Mental Health 1st Aid mandatory in schools & further education
attributes.additional_details: First Aid is essential. There have been several instances where lives have been saved, & time has been bought in between emergency service arrival due to the use of CPR & other First Aid protocol. In addition to this, knife crime is a prevalent issue & it would be useful for young people everywhere to know what to do in these situations, such as preventing further/maximal blood loss. Also there is a mental health epidemic, thus equipping young people with the skills to aid the mentally ill & suffering is needed.
attributes.background: I would like Parliament to make an Act stating that it is compulsory for First Aid (including Mental Health First Aid) to be taught in schools, sixth forms and colleges.

rejection.details:
First Aid is already taught in schools - further information is available in this guidance: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/1090195/Relationships_Education_RSE_and_Health_Education.pdf

You could start a petition asking for mental health first aid to be taught in schools.
